text: I've never been bashful to say that I'm not really interested in Formula One. text: I'm following my dreams and doing what I love as a designer. I did not want to be one of those kids with a famous last name that doesn't do anything. That is very unfulfilling to me and I'm very happy.

text: Books that distribute things... with as daring a freedom as we use in dreams, put us on our feet again.

text: Follow your dreams, work hard, practice and persevere. Make sure you eat a variety of foods, get plenty of exercise and maintain a healthy lifestyle.

text: Literature for me isn't a workaday job, but something which involves desires, dreams and fantasy.
author: Antonio Tabucchi

text: The curse of the romantic is a greed for dreams, an intensity of expectation that, in the end, diminishes the reality.
author: Marya Mannes

text: I'm sick of following my dreams. I'm just going to ask them where they're goin', and hook up with them later.
author: Mitch Hedberg

text: Anderson Cooper every night dreams about getting my job permanently really.
author: Regis Philbin

text: Dreams do come true, even for someone who couldn't speak English and never had a music lesson or much of an education.
author: Lawrence Welk

text: In dreams the truth is learned that all good works are done in the absence of a caress.
author: Leonard Cohen

text: No, I never had any dreams. The process of art is a dream in itself. The artist just doesn't... you work out something. It's yours. You don't have to go to sleep to do that. You do that on the canvas.
author: LeRoy Neiman

text: Love is the most terrible, and also the most generous of the passions it is the only one which includes in its dreams the happiness of someone else.
author: Alphonse Karr

text: I understand it's my role to realize people's dreams. I'm O.K. with that so long as my songs are my own. No one can take my songs away from me.
author: Ayumi Hamasaki

text: One of the dreams of Zionism was to be a bridge. Instead, we are creating exclusion between the East and the West instead of creating bridges we are contributing to the conflict between East and West by our stupid desire to have more.
author: A. B. Yehoshua

text: The old studios that mass-produced dreams are gone with the wind, just like the old downtown theaters that were the temples of the dreams.
author: Suzanne Fields

text: It has never been my object to record my dreams, just the determination to realize them.
author: Man Ray

text: In my childhood, America was like a religion. Then, real-life Americans abruptly entered my life - in jeeps - and upset all my dreams.
author: Sergio Leone

text: When you cease to dream you cease to live.
author: Malcolm Forbes

text: Dreams seem to have a will of their own.
author: Henry Reed

text: So many of my dreams were to actually be able to make a living of what I did as a hobby.
author: Rick Baker

text: Dreams are a scientific fact.
author: Robyn Hitchcock

text: My dreams came true while wearing the opening look from the spring/summer 2010 Dior ready-to-wear collection. I will never forget how special I felt opening John Galliano's show, like I was living a dream.
author: Karlie Kloss

text: When you're a young English person who wants to be an actress and you have dreams, you dream of being Vanessa Redgrave or Judi Dench.
author: Janet McTeer

text: The London Games will be designed for the athletes and we will provide them with the very best venues and the very best conditions to pursue their sporting dreams in London.
author: Sebastian Coe

text: Each man should frame life so that at some future hour fact and his dreaming meet.
author: Victor Hugo

text: I'd definitely be the kind of parent who enabled my child's dreams. I'd just watch and nurture and guide them. I have the blueprints of what not to do... I think I'd be a good parent, actually.
author: Drew Barrymore

text: No matter how carefully you plan your goals they will never be more than pipe dreams unless you pursue them with gusto.
author: W. Clement Stone

text: Never in my wildest dreams did I entertain the idea that I would become a fashion designer.
author: Giorgio Armani

text: My office is at Yankee stadium. Yes, dreams do come true.
author: Derek Jeter

text: Dreaming of a tomorrow, which tomorrow, will be as distant then as 'tis today.
author: Lope de Vega

text: The readers are the ones who let us live our dreams. I try to write books which are really compelling - that you'd take on vacation and rather than going out, you'd read in your hotel room because you had to find out what happened. Hopefully that's what readers are responding to.
author: Harlan Coben

text: Yesterday is but today's memory, and tomorrow is today's dream.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: I'm a journeyman actor, and I don't ever want to forget that. With romantic-lead dreams.
author: William Sanderson

text: You have to dream dreams to live dreams.
author: Eric Lindros

text: The name Air Supply sort of came from nowhere. I get a lot of my things in dreams and I just had a dream about it one night, and I woke up and said that's just got to be the name. That was in 1975.
author: Graham Russell

text: But we can hold our spirits and our bodies so pure and high, we may cherish such thoughts and such ideals, and dream such dreams of lofty purpose, that we can determine and know what manner of men we will be, whenever and wherever the hour strikes and calls to noble action.
author: Joshua Chamberlain

text: Not only the priceless heritage of our fathers, of our seamen, of our Empire builders is being thrown away in a war that serves no British interests - but our alliance leader Stalin dreams of nothing but the destruction of that heritage of our fathers?
author: John Amery

text: 'Do What You Gotta Do' is a positive, inspirational song that says no matter what it is whether you're up against challenges or trying to get your dreams and aspirations met, you should do what whatever you have to do shy of killing yourself or someone else.
author: Angie Stone

text: My parent's divorce and hard times at school, all those things combined to mold me, to make me grow up quicker. And it gave me the drive to pursue my dreams that I wouldn't necessarily have had otherwise.
author: Christina Aguilera

text: I came at age in the '60s, and initially my hopes and dreams were invested in politics and the movements of the time - the anti-war movement, the civil rights movement. I worked on Bobby Kennedy's campaign for president as a teenager in California and the night he was killed.
author: David Talbot

text: I have my own production company called Urban Dreams.
author: Chaske Spencer

text: My mom taught me to go after my dreams. I have this faith in myself that I must have gotten from her.
author: Amy Jo Johnson

text: A player dreams of being a superstar, but he doesn't want people flocking all over him asking for an autograph.
author: Dennis Rodman

text: My professional dreams were coming true while I was living a personal nightmare.
author: Dane Cook

text: If you were to ask my agent, they would confirm this: I'm drawn to locations. What really drew me to 'The 4400,' aside from the fact that it was sci-fi, was the fact that it was shot in the city of my dreams: Vancouver.
author: Billy Campbell

text: Wide awake I can make my most fantastic dreams come true.
author: Lorenz Hart

text: Politics are beautiful. They enable a community to live collectively with one another. It's not about stabbing each other in the back it's about enabling people to reach their dreams and pursue happiness.
author: Ben Nicholson

text: It's surreal to know my dreams are coming true.
author: Mario Vazquez

text: We can escape the commonplace only by manipulating it, controlling it, thrusting it into our dreams or surrendering it to the free play of our subjectivity.
author: Raoul Vaneigem

text: Perhaps life is just that... a dream and a fear.
author: Joseph Conrad

text: I only remember the end of my dreams, like waking up at a steering wheel, or falling.
author: Ben Barnes

text: You must recognize, embrace, and be honest about what is real for you today and allow that understanding to inform the choices you make. Only then will you be able to build the future of your dreams.
author: Suze Orman

text: Our dreams must be stronger than our memories. We must be pulled by our dreams, rater than pushed by our memories.
author: Jesse Jackson

text: They were using the dolls to project their dreams of their own futures as adult women.
author: Ruth Handler

text: After all those days in the cotton fields, the dreams came true on a gold record on a piece of wood. It's in my den where I can look at it every day. I wear it out lookin' at it.

text: You have to dream before your dreams can come true.
author: Abdul Kalam

text: In the year since we brought things into the open with a clean breath of fresh air at City Hall, we have learned about corrupt spending practices and unethical conflicts of interest that waste your money... and keep Dallas from being the great city of our dreams.
author: Laura Miller

text: Each has its lesson for our dreams in sooth, come they in shape of demons, gods, or elves, are allegories with deep hearts of truth that tell us solemn secrets of ourselves.
author: Henry Timrod

text: Hollywood has always been a cage... a cage to catch our dreams.
author: John Huston

text: Rude contact with facts chased my visions and dreams quickly away, and in their stead I beheld the horrors, the corruption, the evils and hypocrisy of society, and as I stood among them, a young wife, a great wail of agony went out from my soul.

text: The only thing that comes to a sleeping man is dreams.
author: Tupac Shakur

text: I was not born in a home where there were stereotypes. So that was very useful because it gave me the sense of possibilities, of flying, if I may say, of making my hopes and dreams a reality.

text: Consult not your fears but your hopes and your dreams. Think not about your frustrations, but about your unfulfilled potential. Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do.

text: Within our dreams and aspirations we find our opportunities.

text: Here Fashion is a despot, and no one dreams of evading its dictates.
author: Marguerite Gardiner

text: Horror, for me, has to involve some sort of fantasy. Horror is something that is in your dreams or your nightmares.

text: He was a dreamer, a thinker, a speculative philosopher... or, as his wife would have it, an idiot.

text: I heard my name associated with the Peter Pan syndrome more than once. But really, what's so wrong with Peter Pan? Peter Pan flies. He is a metaphor for dreams and faith.

text: We've removed the ceiling above our dreams. There are no more impossible dreams.

text: I enjoy making solo albums because over the years it's evolved into more of a genuine personal expression of story-telling and day dreams, and I work in a way that has more control.

text: I mean, we've all had those dreams where, you know, we try to cry out and our voice won't come.

text: The dreams which reveal the supernatural are promises and messages that God sends us directly: they are nothing but His angels, His ministering spirits , who usually appear to us when we are in a great predicament.
author: Paracelsus

text: Real shapes and real patterns are things you would observe in nature, like the marks on the back of a cobra's hood or the markings on a fish or a lizard. Imaginary shapes are just that, symbols that come to a person in dreams or reveries and are charged with meaning.

text: I've said it before, but it's absolutely true: My mother gave me my drive, but my father gave me my dreams. Thanks to him, I could see a future.
author: Liza Minnelli

text: You have all the reason in the world to achieve your grandest dreams. Imagination plus innovation equals realization.

text: I'm a big fan of dreams. Unfortunately, dreams are our first casualty in life - people seem to give them up, quicker than anything, for a 'reality.'

text: It's insecurity that is always chasing you and standing in the way of your dreams.
author: Vin Diesel

text: There are a lot of things that are personally uncomfortable to show, especially me without makeup and completely bloated or crying. But I've realized that it's time for me to show my audience that you don't have to be perfect to achieve your dreams. Because nobody relates to being perfect.

text: The life of a man consists not in seeing visions and in dreaming dreams, but in active charity and in willing service.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

text: All books are either dreams or swords, you can cut, or you can drug, with words.
author: Amy Lowell

text: They should hold themselves absolutely upon the immovable foundation of truth and nature, whereby alone they can save themselves from misapprehensions and from the danger of being entirely carried away from reality into mere dreams and fictions.
author: Ethan A. Hitchcock

text: I love to fly. I always wanted to fly. It's been one of my dreams since I was 3 years old. I remember saying to my mom, 3 years old, every day, 'I can fly!' Living on the ninth floor, it was dangerous.
author: Elena Anaya

text: Writers write. Dreamers talk about it.
author: Jerry B. Jenkins

text: I have been interested in dreams, really since I was a kid. I have always been fascinated by the idea that your mind, when you are asleep, can create a world in a dream and you are perceiving it as though it really existed.
author: Christopher Nolan

text: Saddle your dreams before you ride em.
author: Mary Webb

text: Keep your dreams alive. Understand to achieve anything requires faith and belief in yourself, vision, hard work, determination, and dedication. Remember all things are possible for those who believe.
author: Gail Devers

text: The greatest achievement was at first and for a time a dream. The oak sleeps in the acorn, the bird waits in the egg, and in the highest vision of the soul a waking angel stirs. Dreams are the seedlings of realities.

text: I can have my goals, and I can have my dreams. My goal is to make the finals and improve my position. I want to run all decent races. I don't want to look back and say I ran a terrible race.

text: As a child our dreams got scattered all about and all our future prospects got scattered to so many places, and we spend our lives trying to find the little pieces that make up our lives and make up the dreams that we had as a child that got blown away in the windstorm.

text: All human beings are also dream beings. Dreaming ties all mankind together.
author: Jack Kerouac

text: I can think of some things that would be fun, but I'm living my dreams.
author: Mike Farrell

text: Only in our dreams are we free. The rest of the time we need wages.
author: Terry Pratchett

text: My life turned out to be beyond my greatest dreams.
author: Anthony Hopkins

text: All men of action are dreamers.
author: James Huneker

text: We don't have an eternity to realize our dreams, only the time we are here.
author: Susan Taylor

text: Never set limits, go after your dreams, don't be afraid to push the boundaries. And laugh a lot - it's good for you!
author: Paula Radcliffe

text: Humanity needs dreams to be able to survive the miseries of daily existence, even if only for an instant.

text: If a man dreams that he has committed a sin before which the sun hid his face, it is often safe to conjecture that, in sheer forgetfulness, he wore a red tie, or brown boots with evening dress.

text: I still marvel at how God turns dreams into reality.

text: There's always going to be dreams and goals I have, but I never really tell people what they are.

text: Dreams can be like charades in which we act out words rather than see or speak them.

text: Dreams are illusions, and we can't let go of them because we would be dead.

text: Genius is an African who dreams up snow.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

text: You know, one of my biggest dreams in life is to play a Disney princess.

text: In the fifties I had dreams about touching a naked woman and she would turn to bronze or the dream about hot dogs chasing donuts through the Lincoln Tunnel.

text: Whatever dreams I have wished have come true.
author: Annette Funicello

text: I have those dreams that you can't put into words.
author: Harry Connick, Jr.

text: My dreams were at once more fantastic and agreeable than my writings.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

text: Ocean is more ancient than the mountains, and freighted with the memories and the dreams of Time.
author: H. P. Lovecraft

text: Though we may have desires or bold goals, for whatever reason, most of us don't think we can achieve something beyond what we're qualified to achieve. Why, I ask, do we let reality interfere with our dreams?

text: I don't have dreams. How can I say it? I myself am a dream.

text: I wasn't prepared to get a mammogram until I was 40 years old, like I'd been told. I never in my wildest dreams expected anything to be wrong.
author: Giuliana Rancic

text: Dreams have always expanded our understanding of reality by challenging our boundaries of the real, of the possible.

text: Good dreams don't come cheap, you've got to pay for them and If you just dream when you're asleep this is no way for them to come alive... to survive.
author: Harry Chapin

text: Freedom and democracy are dreams you never give up.
author: Aung San Suu Kyi

text: I'm not certain, but I have a little gypsy blood in me. And my mother always told me that her grandma could give someone the evil eye, and I'd better not cross her because she had some of that blood in her. Mother always believed that she could predict the future, and she had dreams that came true.
author: Sam Raimi

text: Mitt Romney will stop the attacks on job creators, encourage entrepreneurs to chase their dreams, and bring good jobs and a better future to all Americans.
author: Marco Rubio

text: I just write what I wanted to write. I write what amuses me. It's totally for myself. I never in my wildest dreams expected this popularity.

text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: It is in our idleness, in our dreams, that the submerged truth sometimes comes to the top.

text: Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there, wondering, fearing, doubting, dreaming dreams no mortal ever dared to dream before.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: Sometimes, the only realists are the dreamers.
author: Paul Wellstone

text: My dreams are of water. And my nightmares.
author: Siouxsie Sioux

text: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with success unexpected in common hours.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: All the things one has forgotten scream for help in dreams.

text: No man's brain is so dull, and no man's eye so blind, that they cannot catch food for dreams.
author: Donald G. Mitchell

text: Too many athletes are living in a tiny window. They have no vision for themselves - what they can be outside of football and what they can mean to a community. They just don't know any better. My hopes and dreams are unlimited.

text: Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours.
author: Les Brown

text: If there are dreams about a beautiful South Africa, there are also roads that lead to their goal. Two of these roads could be named Goodness and Forgiveness.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The real hero is always a hero by mistake he dreams of being an honest coward like everybody else.
author: Umberto Eco

text: Trust in dreams, for in them is hidden the gate to eternity.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: There's a logic to dreams that doesn't necessarily follow linear narrative. You don't know why things happen, it's your subconscious pushing you, to give you information.

text: Dreams can come true.
author: Lil' Romeo

text: We must stop talking about the American dream and start listening to the dreams of Americans.
author: Max Beerbohm

text: I never paint dreams or nightmares. I paint my own reality.

text: Lonesome. Lonesome. I know what it means. Here all by my lonesome, dreaming empty dreams. Weary. Weary at the close of day, wondering if tomorrow brings me joy or sorrow.
