text: But I have been interested in dreams, really since I was a kid. I have always been fascinated by the idea that your mind, when you are asleep, can create a world in a dream and you are perceiving it as though it really existed.
author: Christopher Nolan

text: My dreams for the future are simple: work, a happy, healthy family, a lovely long motorcycle ride, and continuing the struggle to awaken people to the need for serious human rights reform.
author: Mike Farrell

text: At first, dreams seem impossible, then improbable, and eventually inevitable.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: Dreams are today's answers to tomorrow's questions.
author: Edgar Cayce

text: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Freud published The Interpretation of Dreams in 1900. It introduced the notion that there existed certain predictable and identifiable processes by which dreams were formed.
author: Henry Reed

text: From time immemorial artistic insights have been revealed to artists in their sleep and in dreams, so that at all times they ardently desired them.
author: Paracelsus

text: I think everyone dreams of that nice romantic wedding.
author: Lance Bass

text: If there were dreams to sell, what would you buy?
author: Thomas Lovell Beddoes

text: But what I was going to say was, I just figured I'm going to go boldly in the direction of my dreams, say it as Thoreau would say, and just see where it takes me.
author: Demetri Martin

text: Yet it is in our idleness, in our dreams, that the submerged truth sometimes comes to the top.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Man is firmly convinced that he is awake in reality he is caught in a net of sleep and dreams which he has unconsciously woven himself.
author: Gustave Meyrink

text: Just what future the Designer of the universe has provided for the souls of men I do not know, I cannot prove. But I find that the whole order of Nature confirms my confidence that, if it is not like our noblest hopes and dreams, it will transcend them.
author: Henry Norris Russell

text: Take what you can from your dreams, make them as real as anything.
author: Dave Matthews

text: Technology has a great advantage in that we are capable of creating dinosaurs and show them on the screen even though they are extinct 65 million years. All of a sudden, we have a fantastic tool that is as good as dreams are.
author: Werner Herzog

text: We are near waking when we dream we are dreaming.
author: Novalis

text: The work of an advertising agency is warmly and immediately human. It deals with human needs, wants, dreams and hopes. Its 'product' cannot be turned out on an assembly line.
author: Leo Burnett

text: You don't get old until you replace dreams with regrets.
author: Troy Dumais

text: 'The Cut' is going to give someone the opportunity of a lifetime and help that person achieve his or her dreams.
author: Tommy Hilfiger

text: Gradually it occurred to me that we spend a great deal of life asleep and that dreams are little narratives, little stories. I thought, 'Who's choreographing this stuff?'
author: Sue Monk Kidd

text: Don't give up your dreams.
author: Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy

text: I love watching people's dreams come true.
author: Jessica Simpson

text: My fear is that I go up to the girl of my dreams and say 'I'm sorry, but I've got to say hello to you,' and she slides the stool back and gets up and walks away, saying, 'Not for me, Bub. I don't want anything to do with you.'
author: John Mayer

text: Lose your dreams and you might lose your mind.
author: Mick Jagger

text: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: My career was full of struggles and dreams, disappointments and peaks and valleys. But there was no Twitter, no Facebook or TMZ. Young actors could make mistakes and not become the focus of tabloids.
author: Ricky Schroder

text: No one may speak for the dead, no one may interpret their mutilated dreams and visions.
author: Elie Wiesel

text: Those who have compared our life to a dream were right... we were sleeping wake, and waking sleep.
author: Michel de Montaigne

text: A dream is a scripture, and many scriptures are nothing but dreams.
author: Umberto Eco

text: I had some wonderful dreaming meetings. I can't tell you specifically what they've been in the recent months. In the past they've been verbal kinds of messages that he needed to give me. Now they're more dreams of his presence.
author: Judy Collins

text: With Shakespeare and poetry, a new world was born. New dreams, new desires, a self consciousness was born. I desired to know to know myself in terms of the new standards set by these books.
author: Peter Abrahams

text: The ideal of all Kosovo is membership in the E.U. and a permanent friendship with the United States. I believe and I am convinced our dreams will come true.
author: Atifete Jahjaga

text: Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: We need affordable space travel to inspire our youth, to let them know that they can experience their dreams, can set significant goals and be in a position to lead all of us to future progress in exploration, discovery and fun. Thanks to the X Prize for the inspiration.
author: Burt Rutan

text: I actually build my dreams around the dancers I've got in my company.
author: Graeme Murphy

text: It was a lovely opportunity for the first time in my whole career to stand up and thank people who are really responsible for me getting to realize my dreams.
author: Rachel Griffiths

text: There are a lot of things that are personally uncomfortable to show, especially me without makeup and completely bloated or crying. But I've realized that it's time for me to show my audience that you don't have to be perfect to achieve your dreams.
author: Katy Perry

text: To provoke dreams of terror in the slumber of prosperity has become the moral duty of literature.
author: Ernst Fischer

text: We do not really feel grateful toward those who make our dreams come true they ruin our dreams.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: I can't sing but I can understand wanting to keep a balance, trying to pursue dreams, while creating a stable environment for my children.
author: Gabrielle Reece

text: Like all dreamers, I mistook disenchantment for truth.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: So we see Edward as a young man on the road and he meets a giant and he brings the giant to a circus where he meets a Miss Calloway. He sees the woman of his dreams and I am the only one who knows who she is.
author: Danny DeVito

text: Dreaming men are haunted men.
author: Stephen Vincent Benet

text: I had dreams, but I didn't have the sense that they would necessarily work out. They seemed very far-fetched.
author: Greta Gerwig

text: Though I know he loves me, tonight my heart is sad his kiss was not so wonderful as all the dreams I had.
author: Sara Teasdale

text: I am so excited to let fans in on how important my relationship with my family is to me. I hope to motivate mothers and daughters to build lifetimes of memories together and inspire kids around the world to live their dreams.
author: Miley Cyrus

text: A lot of people put pressure on themselves and think it will be way too hard for them to live out their dreams. Mentors are there to say, 'Look, it's not that tough. It's not as hard as you think. Here are some guidelines and things I have gone through to get to where I am in my career.'
author: Joe Jonas

text: We should never discourage young people from dreaming dreams.
author: Lenny Wilkens

text: I would go to bed every night and have dreams about having a time machine and somehow I'd have the ability to move through time and space freely, and save Anne Frank.
author: Jeff Mangum

text: Dream small dreams. If you make them too big, you get overwhelmed and you don't do anything. If you make small goals and accomplish them, it gives you the confidence to go on to higher goals.
author: John H. Johnson

text: Judge of your natural character by what you do in your dreams.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: I think I am done with Wikipedia for the time being. But I have a secret hope. Someone recently proposed a Wikimorgue - a bin of broken dreams where all rejects could still be read, as long as they weren't libelous or otherwise illegal.
author: Nicholson Baker

text: Dreams are true while they last, and do we not live in dreams?
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

text: Our life is composed greatly from dreams, from the unconscious, and they must be brought into connection with action. They must be woven together.
author: Anais Nin

text: When your dreams tire, they go underground and out of kindness that's where they stay.
author: Libby Houston

text: Follow your dreams. Just make sure to have fun too.
author: Chris Brown

text: The Washington black community was able to succeed beyond his wildest dreams. I mean, we had our own newspapers, our own restaurants, our own theaters, our own small shops, our own clubs, our own Masonic lodges.
author: Ed Smith

text: I believe dreams represent the purest form of fantasy we unleash through our subconscious. They represent the truest freedom we can experience. Totally unrepressed and totally creative.
author: Miguel Jontel Pimentel

text: When you're a kid, you have these big ideas and these big dreams to make a change, or maybe you feel like you can't make a difference.
author: AnnaSophia Robb

text: You have many years ahead of you to create the dreams that we can't even imagine dreaming. You have done more for the collective unconscious of this planet than you will ever know.
author: Steven Spielberg

text: Much can be inferred about a man from his mistress: in her one beholds his weaknesses and his dreams.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

text: Men never cling to their dreams with such tenacity as at the moment when they are losing faith in them, and know it, but do not dare yet to confess it to themselves.
author: William Graham Sumner

text: One day it just hit me. This is it. You are not in love. So either stay in it because you have a child or be brave and find the man of your dreams and marry him for real.
author: Brandy Norwood

text: People's dreams are made out of what they do all day. The same way a dog that runs after rabbits will dream of rabbits. It's what you do that makes your soul, not the other way around.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

text: You can't break my spirit, it's my dreams you take.
author: James Blunt

text: People don't think their dreams amount to much, but when I ask them to examine them for common themes, they surprise themselves at how accurate they are! They see that their dreams have value.
author: Henry Reed

text: If our dreams were more regular, more connected, more stable, they would also have more practical importance for us.
author: Ernst Mach

text: We must not let our passions destroy our dreams.
author: Thomas S. Monson

text: We use our parents like recurring dreams, to be entered into when needed.
author: Doris Lessing

text: The hoary joke in the literary world, based on 'Dreams From My Father,' was that if things had worked out differently for Barack Obama, he could have made it as a writer.
author: James Fallows

text: My dreams and aspirations when I was a child for as long as I can remember was to be an entertainer.
author: Brittany Murphy

text: I have a notebook that is filled to the brim with my dreams and ideas and goals and aspirations.
author: Karlie Kloss

text: The man who never dreams, goes slowly mad.
author: Thomas Dolby

text: In opposition to this detachment, he finds an image of man which contains within itself man's dreams, man's illness, man's redemption from the misery of poverty - poverty which can no longer be for him a sign of the acceptance of life.
author: Salvatore Quasimodo

text: I say to my colleagues never confine your best work, your hopes, your dreams, the aspiration of the American people to what will be signed by George W. Bush because that is too limiting a factor.
author: Nancy Pelosi

text: Deep down, I'm a Texas girl looking for that big romance every girl dreams about. Biologically, I look forward to being a cornerstone of a family. I'll be in my glory when I have a child on my knee.
author: Renee Zellweger

text: I was a great dreamer of day dreams.
author: Abraham Cahan

text: I tell people I'm too stupid to know what's impossible. I have ridiculously large dreams, and half the time they come true.
author: Debi Thomas

text: I understand it's my role to realize people's dreams.
author: Ayumi Hamasaki

text: I was always a closet lover of acting. My mom was very practical. She never, ever restricted our dreams, always told us we could do or be anything. Then I said, 'Maybe I want to be an actor'. And she said, 'Maybe not that'.
author: Octavia Spencer

text: I think there must be a place inside of us where dreams go and wait their turn.
author: Sue Monk Kidd

text: I am a dreamer. Seriously, I'm living on another planet.
author: Eva Green

text: American dreams are strongest in the hearts of those who have seen America only in their dreams.
author: Pico Iyer

text: I am against nature. I don't dig nature at all. I think nature is very unnatural. I think the truly natural things are dreams, which nature can't touch with decay.
author: Bob Dylan

text: I knew I wanted to do something creative. I didn't think I'd have the luxury of doing something like that, because I didn't know anyone who had pursued anything they really adored, but I had dreams for singing or writing.
author: Lana Del Rey

text: The way to kill a man or a nation is to cut off his dreams, the way the whites are taking care of the Indians: killing their dreams, their magic, their familiar spirits.
author: William S. Burroughs

text: Dreams are necessary to life.
author: Anais Nin

text: Dream the impossible because dreams do come true.
author: Elijah Wood

text: Everyone wants to look their best, everyone has dreams of wanting to look like something else. But we are who we are.
author: Samantha Morton

text: It's not like I had big dreams to go to California and become an actor. I loved doing my shows at school and community theater, and I probably would have settled in New York because it was closer. I was going to go to NYU.
author: Christine Taylor

text: You have the dreams that you want, and then you have to do other jobs until you can get to that dream.
author: Channing Tatum

text: No person has the right to rain on your dreams.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

text: It was never in my dreams to make my personal life anybody else's business.
author: Ethan Hawke

text: A successful life is one that is lived through understanding and pursuing one's own path, not chasing after the dreams of others.
author: Chin-Ning Chu

text: When I was a kid, I have two dreams. I want to be a baseball player. Hometown, Hiroshima, has a Japanese baseball franchise team called Hiroshima Carps. You know, and then I want to be a sushi chef. I want to make own restaurant - sushi restaurant.
author: Masaharu Morimoto

text: The Hispanic community values entrepreneurship and family-owned businesses, and we deserve a leader in Washington who is dedicated to creating an environment where our values, our goals and our dreams of prosperity can become reality.
author: Mario Diaz-Balart

text: Whoever I can go out every week and motivate to do better and to try to go after their dreams, I'm up for that.
author: Robert Griffin III

text: Dreams are the touchstones of our character.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Men are the dreams of a shadow.
author: Pindar

text: Most 'reality' shows aren't reality at all. They're game shows with no prize. Like 'Rock of Love.' His aren't genuine feelings. Then again, Bob Barker didn't really care whether or not you won the toaster. Sorry to shatter everyone's dreams.
author: Hal Sparks

text: The atmosphere is much too near for dreams. It forces us to action. It is close to us. We are in it and of it. It rouses us both to study and to do. We must know its moods and also its motive forces.
author: Cleveland Abbe

text: I do not know whether I was then a man dreaming I was a butterfly, or whether I am now a butterfly dreaming I am a man.
author: Zhuangzi

text: What better model of a synthesis than a nocturnal dream? Dreams simplify, don't they?
author: Manuel Puig

text: I can't comprehend that I'm in the film of 'Les Miserables.' It's one of those dreams I thought would be unattainable for someone like me, who came from nowhere.
author: Samantha Barks

text: Sigmund Freud said we act out our own dreams, but if you are only an actor you are not acting out your own dream. You are simply participating in someone else's dream.
author: John Malkovich

text: What is a television apparatus to man, who has only to shut his eyes to see the most inaccessible regions of the seen and the never seen, who has only to imagine in order to pierce through walls and cause all the planetary Baghdads of his dreams to rise from the dust.
author: Salvador Dali

text: There has been enough suffering in our country, there has been enough of children whose dreams die before they have a chance to grow and there has been enough of our elders who, having served their nation, are forced into indignity in their old age.
author: John Agyekum Kufuor

text: To see your friend's dreams come true, there's really nothing that can make you happier.
author: Josh Hopkins

text: But are not the dreams of poets and the tales of travellers notoriously false?
author: H. P. Lovecraft

text: Every comedian dreams of hosting 'The Tonight Show' and, for seven months, I got to. I did it my way, with people I love, and I do not regret a second.
author: Conan O'Brien

text: People need dreams, there's as much nourishment in 'em as food.
author: Dorothy Gilman

text: People have to remain positive and believe in those dreams. It's really important.
author: Kirsty Coventry

text: To become truly immortal, a work of art must escape all human limits: logic and common sense will only interfere. But once these barriers are broken, it will enter the realms of childhood visions and dreams.
author: Giorgio de Chirico

text: I am a child of Hollywood and dreams. To me, to be on the red carpet is the best place in the world.
author: Steven Cojocaru

text: Hopes are but the dreams of those that wake.
author: Matthew Prior

text: We can bring to characters dark and bright sides that nobody even dreams about.
author: Sonia Braga

text: The worst thing you can do to a kid is tell them that their dreams are invalid.
author: Juliette Lewis

text: The great function of poetry is to give back to us the situations of our dreams.
author: Gaston Bachelard

text: If there is one place on the face of earth where all the dreams of living men have found a home from the very earliest days when man began the dream of existence, it is India.
author: Romain Rolland

text: Great dreams of great dreamers are always transcended.
author: Abdul Kalam

text: When I grew up, I only had two dreams. One was to be a cowboy and another was to be in the military. I grew up extremely patriotic and riding horses.
author: Chris Kyle

text: Well, my thoughts about California are kind of mythological. To me, as well as being a real place, it's a place where people go to find something - to find happiness or to realize their dreams. So it has that kind of quality of heroism and heartache, and Australia has that, as well.
author: Colin Hay

text: I think when you move past your fear and you go after your dreams wholeheartedly, you become free.
author: LL Cool J

text: To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream not only plan, but also believe.
author: Anatole France

text: One of the most adventurous things left us is to go to bed. For no one can lay a hand on our dreams.
author: E. V. Lucas

text: To all, to each, a fair good-night, and pleasing dreams, and slumbers light.
author: Walter Scott

text: This is the city of dreamers and time and again it's the place where the greatest dream of all, the American dream, has been tested and has triumphed.
author: Michael Bloomberg

text: I would like to see anyone be able to achieve their dreams, and that's what this organization does.
author: Sergey Brin

text: Catcher in the Rye had a profound impact on me-the idea that we all have lots of dreams that are slowly being chipped away as we grow up.
author: Judd Nelson

text: Dream in a pragmatic way.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: I'm a dreamer. I have to dream and reach for the stars, and if I miss a star then I grab a handful of clouds.
author: Mike Tyson

text: It is all nonsense, to be sure and so much the greater nonsense inasmuch as the true interpretation of many dreams - not by any means of all dreams - moves, it may be said, in the opposite direction to the method of psycho-analysis.
author: Arthur Machen

text: It is an everlasting desire to make my dreams come true. And it's getting to the point now where it's like, come on I want my dreams to come true so that I can get on with the rest of my life. Sometimes I think about the rest of my life when I'm done.
author: Picabo Street

text: Seems like half my anxiety dreams are about airports.
author: Lois McMaster Bujold

text: This city can be kind of brutal, so you see your dreams from every different angle, but ultimately it's about acting and if you enjoy acting, you will always enjoy acting.
author: Radha Mitchell

text: Winners, I am convinced, imagine their dreams first. They want it with all their heart and expect it to come true. There is, I believe, no other way to live.
author: Joe Montana

text: As I live and am a man, this is an unexaggerated tale - my dreams become the substances of my life.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

text: I believe in everything until it's disproved. So I believe in fairies, the myths, dragons. It all exists, even if it's in your mind. Who's to say that dreams and nightmares aren't as real as the here and now?
author: John Lennon

text: I paint what cannot be photographed, that which comes from the imagination or from dreams, or from an unconscious drive.
author: Man Ray

text: Do all you can to make your dreams come true.
author: Joel Osteen

text: I try to help people realize their dreams by using magic to tell stories that educate, move, and inspire.
author: David Copperfield

text: People who insist on telling their dreams are among the terrors of the breakfast table.
author: Max Beerbohm

text: It has been my observation that parents kill more dreams than anybody.
author: Spike Lee

text: Worse than not realizing the dreams of your youth, would be to have been young and never dreamed at all.
author: Jean Genet

text: I have shared my whole life. My private and my show business life. It helps me actually to feel my songs and to go on with my dreams.
author: Celine Dion

text: I'd say it's been my biggest problem all my life... it's money. It takes a lot of money to make these dreams come true.
author: Walt Disney

text: Without peace, all other dreams vanish and are reduced to ashes.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

text: My dreams were always small and puny. All I ever needed was a little house with a little picket fence by the sea. Little did I know that I would live in Malacanang Palace for 20 years and visit all the major palaces of mankind. And then also meet ordinary citizens and the leaders of superpowers.
author: Imelda Marcos

text: Hold fast to dreams For when dreams go Life is a barren field Frozen with snow.
author: Langston Hughes

text: The Olympics is about letting people believe in their own dreams.
author: Kyle Shewfelt

text: Dream lofty dreams, and as you dream, so you shall become. Your vision is the promise of what you shall one day be your ideal is the prophecy of what you shall at last unveil.
author: James Lane Allen

text: There's a good deal in common between the mind's eye and the TV screen, and though the TV set has all too often been the boobtube, it could be, it can be, the box of dreams.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

text: You have to have a dream so you can get up in the morning.
author: Billy Wilder

text: It is possible for a kid from east Texas, raised in south central LA and Carson, who believes in his dreams, commits himself to them with his heart, to touch them and to have them happen.
author: Forest Whitaker

text: Strivers achieve what dreamers believe.
author: Usher

text: I've accomplished a lot, but I still have more dreams that I want to achieve.
author: Joe Jonas

text: Let your dreams outgrow the shoes of your expectations.
author: Ryunosuke Satoro

text: The buildings that I build very often have a dreamlike reality. I don't mean by that they have a fantasy quality at all, in fact quite the reverse. They contain in some degree the ingredients that give dreams their power... stuff that's very close to us.
author: Christopher Alexander

text: When a child, my dreams rode on your wishes, I was your son, high on your horse, My mind a top whipped by the lashes Of your rhetoric, windy of course.
author: Stephen Spender

text: Perhaps, all writers walk such a line. In general - as we all do in our dreams - I believe I put something of myself into all the characters in my novels, male as well as female.
author: Rose Tremain

text: I married the man of my dreams in 1998.
author: Cindy Margolis

text: Most of my actor friends don't believe it's possible to let go of it and be happy, and for a while that was true for me. For the first two years I ached, every day. And I had such bad dreams. But then I made the decision to start working on my little shop and all that went away.
author: Genie Francis

text: She still talks to me now, only now she talks to me in my dreams. And I can't wait to go to sleep tonight because we have a lot to talk about. I love you.
author: Jamie Foxx

text: I'm living out my dreams and I love what I do.
author: Ashley Tisdale

text: Don't think your dreams don't come true, because they do. You'd better be careful what you wish for. And I truly and honestly - one day I am doing the 'Beaver' show and I said, 'This is the show I have always wanted to do.'
author: Barbara Billingsley

text: When I was in high school, I don't know that I really had big dreams.
author: Alan Jackson

text: Dreams come true without that possibility, nature would not incite us to have them.
author: John Updike

text: Dreaming in public is an important part of our job description, as science writers, but there are bad dreams as well as good dreams. We're dreamers, you see, but we're also realists, of a sort.
author: William Gibson

text: You can plant a dream.
author: Anne Campbell

text: Everyone dreams, but not everybody remembers their dreams because some people go into delta they go too low.
author: Sylvia Browne

text: College baseball, I love it. I love to work with the younger kids who are trying to live out their dreams, if in fact that's what they plan on doing after college to take the next step.
author: Roger Clemens

text: Hold fast to dreams, for if dreams die, life is a broken-winged bird that cannot fly.
author: Langston Hughes

text: I love to work with the younger kids who are trying to live out their dreams, if in fact that's what they plan on doing after college to take the next step. A very select few have that opportunity so when you do have the opportunity you know, those guys take advantage of it.
author: Roger Clemens

text: Dreams become reality when we put our minds to it.
author: Queen Latifah

text: I worshipped Berry Gordy for the creative dreams he had made come true.
author: Martha Reeves

text: I was always someone who lived in the future all the time, it was always the next thing - dreams of escape.
author: Julie Walters

text: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams who looks inside, awakes.
author: Carl Jung

text: Even having to do the amount of press that I have to do is dreadful and gives me so much anxiety. After having done this whole slew of press for 'Big Love,' now I'll have anxiety dreams for like a week and a half about all the stupid things I said.
author: Chloe Sevigny

text: Only the dreamer shall understand realities, though in truth his dreaming must be not out of proportion to his waking.
author: Margaret Fuller

text: I've been interested in dreams since I as a kid and I've wanted to do a film about them for a long time.
author: Christopher Nolan

text: I've woken up from dreams and the whole song is there. I'm listening to it in my dreams. I consciously have to wake myself up and get a tape recorder because I hear it like a record.
author: Lenny Kravitz

text: All men dream, but not equally. Those who dream by night in the dusty recesses of their minds, wake in the day to find that it was vanity: but the dreamers of the day are dangerous men, for they may act on their dreams with open eyes, to make them possible.
author: T. E. Lawrence

text: I am rich beyond the dreams of avarice.
author: Edward Moore

text: In dreams begins responsibility.
author: William Butler Yeats

text: I think when you're in a relationship where you really care for the other person, when they achieve their dreams it's better than when you do yourself.
author: Nicole Kidman

text: Life being what it is, one dreams of revenge.
author: Paul Gauguin

text: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.
author: Les Brown

text: When we are motivated by goals that have deep meaning, by dreams that need completion, by pure love that needs expressing, then we truly live.
author: Greg Anderson

text: I would love to spend all my time writing to you I'd love to share with you all that goes through my mind, all that weighs on my heart, all that gives air to my soul phantoms of art, dreams that would be so beautiful if they could come true.
author: Luigi Pirandello

text: We become not a melting pot but a beautiful mosaic. Different people, different beliefs, different yearnings, different hopes, different dreams.
author: Jimmy Carter

text: I never felt I would be part of the international scene for 50 caps in my wildest dreams.
author: Kenny Cunningham

text: People are never more insecure than when they become obsessed with their fears at the expense of their dreams.
author: Norman Cousins

text: I don't dream songs. I'm more apt to write dreams down and then to be able to interpret them into a song. I also tend to get up and write prose in the morning from which will come songs.
author: Judy Collins

text: Now, everybody, I suppose, is aware that in recent years the silly business of divination by dreams has ceased to be a joke and has become a very serious science.
author: Arthur Machen

text: My mother dreamed dreams for Joaquin and for me long before we could dream them for ourselves.
author: Julian Castro

text: My childhood dreams were focused on being part of the effort to make humanity a multiplanetary species.
author: Peter Diamandis

text: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
author: Anais Nin

text: I close my eyes, then I drift away, into the magic night I softly say. A silent prayer, like dreamers do, then I fall asleep to dream my dreams of you.
author: Roy Orbison

text: Don't let your dreams be dreams.
author: Jack Johnson

text: You know, Willie Wonka said it best: we are the makers of dreams, the dreamers of dreams.
author: Herb Brooks

text: A dream doesn't become reality through magic it takes sweat, determination and hard work.
author: Colin Powell

text: My work is to reach people with ideas, hopes, dreams, encouragement, insight, and revelation. That's what an actor wants to do.
author: John Astin

text: I've been blessed by doing classic plays on Broadway, which was one of my great dreams forever.
author: Michael Emerson

text: Why does the eye see a thing more clearly in dreams than the imagination when awake?
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: I appreciate everything that has been done for me. After a difficult start, I've just followed my dreams.
author: Victor Ortiz

text: As I watched bookstores close, I began to wonder how that felt for the owners. Owning a bookstore was their dream and now they're struggling and seeing those dreams fall apart.
author: Karen Kingsbury

text: I always knew that we were going to be successful and accomplish and succeed at our dreams. There was never a doubt in my mind. When we were recording 'Appetite For Destruction,' we all knew.
author: Steven Adler

text: If you have a dream, just lie about it. Lie your way unto your dreams.
author: Joel McHale

text: To be here today is just beyond my wildest dreams.
author: Rick Yune

text: Follow your passion, be prepared to work hard and sacrifice, and, above all, don't let anyone limit your dreams.
author: Donovan Bailey

text: If you dream the proper dreams, and share the myths with people, they will want to grow up to be like you.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: We should be dreaming. We grew up as kids having dreams, but now we're too sophisticated as adults, as a nation. We stopped dreaming. We should always have dreams.
author: Herb Brooks

text: I want to find someone who's really into something like I'm really into something, so that I can support them and we can both cheer each other on. I've got a lot of dreams I want to achieve, and I hope someone can cheer me on as I'll cheer them on in their dreams.
author: Hunter Hayes

text: Right now, I have some big dreams. But at the same time, if I get annoyed and harassed by the media, I'll just quit. I don't care. We're set for life. I have quite a temper.
author: Anna Benson

text: It is not true that people stop pursuing dreams because they grow old, they grow old because they stop pursuing dreams.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

text: We are people with all the hopes, dreams, passions, and faults of everyone else. Eighty percent of us are born into families with no history of dwarfism.
author: Billy Barty

text: Everybody's a dreamer.
author: John Lithgow

text: Youth is in a grand flush, like the hot days of ending summer and pleasant dreams thrall your spirit, like the smoky atmosphere that bathes the landscape of an August day.
author: Donald G. Mitchell

text: I know it sounds corny, but when you follow your dreams, it happens. And if it's music, take it seriously.
author: Enrique Iglesias

text: Flying dreams mean that you're doing the right thing with your life.
author: Doug Coupland

text: Dream study impacts culture. We are put in touch with the inner poet who dreams. We hear our inner, subjective response to the outer world. That helps spiritualize our lives.
author: Henry Reed

text: Dreams have only one owner at a time. That's why dreamers are lonely.
author: Erma Bombeck

text: But baseball bounced back in the next decade to reclaim its place as the national pastime: new heroes, spirited competition, and booming prosperity gave birth to dreams of expansion, both within the major leagues and around the world.
author: John Thorn

text: We're special because dreams that are impossible anywhere else, come true here. That's not just my story. That's your story. That's our story.
author: Marco Rubio

text: I think there's a time as a writer when you want to see the best things in life, and you go out wherever you go with your dreams as a writer or a composer.
author: Tori Amos

text: There's a joy and a pain about directing where the dreams you have are becoming concrete but the attention to detail, the need for time is such that it's overwhelming at times, and the stream of responsibility.
author: William Shatner

text: I want to keep my dreams, even bad ones, because without them, I might have nothing all night long.
author: Joseph Heller

text: I might be writing what people expect me to write, writing from that place where I might be ruled by economic considerations. To overcome that, I started working with my dreams, because I'm not so censored when I use dream material.
author: Kathy Acker

text: I have dreamed in my life, dreams that have stayed with me ever after, and changed my ideas they have gone through and through me, like wine through water, and altered the color of my mind.
author: Emily Bronte

text: All of us gave it all we've got, overcame a whole lot just being on the show and learned a lot about ourselves. We're just normal people trying to do what we love and follow our dreams.
author: Carrie Underwood

text: So many of our dreams at first seem impossible, then they seem improbable, and then, when we summon the will, they soon become inevitable.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: You've got to have a dream... if you don't have any big dreams, nothing happens.
author: Ian Rush

text: Every year for New Years I write down all of my goals and dreams and put them in my Bible. At the end of the year I go and pull the paper out and check this off and check that off.
author: NeNe Leakes

text: Sometimes, you follow your dreams. I say to the young people, 'If you have a dream, chase it.'
author: Karl Malone

text: We used to talk about wanting to get some money, but that's when hip-hop was based on your dreams and your fantasy. The whole thing now is the dreams and fantasies were achieved, and you don't want to make it the focal point. You can't keep beating that dead horse.
author: Puff Daddy

text: Dreams are like paper, they tear so easily.
author: Gilda Radner

text: It is exactly because we are a city that embraces freedom, that welcomes everyone and encourages their dreams, that New York remains on the front lines in the war on terror.
author: Michael Bloomberg

text: Myths are public dreams, dreams are private myths.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: The Columbia is lost, but the dreams that inspired its crew remain with us.
author: Dick Cheney

text: Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.
author: William Butler Yeats

text: There are those who look at things the way they are, and ask why... I dream of things that never were, and ask why not?
author: Robert Kennedy

text: There's a lot of blood, sweat, and guts between dreams and success.
author: Paul Bryant

text: You'll be much more successful if you follow your dreams and follow your passions.
author: Jay Weatherill

text: We all have dreams. But in order to make dreams come into reality, it takes an awful lot of determination, dedication, self-discipline, and effort.
author: Jesse Owens

text: I stand for freedom of expression, doing what you believe in, and going after your dreams.
author: Madonna Ciccone

text: Today, I'm very happy about myself, because I realized my dreams. I learned how to understand what people want.
author: Roberto Cavalli

text: The idea of being able to serve as an example, based upon how to process, how to think, how to realize our own dreams, we can pass that down to our children.
author: Stedman Graham

text: I challenge you to be dreamers I challenge you to be doers and let us make the greatest place in the world even better.
author: Brian Schweitzer

text: Talking, talking. Spinning a web of words, pale walls of dreams, between myself and all I see.
author: John Gardner

text: I have always been amazed at the way an ordinary observer lends so much more credence and attaches so much more importance to waking events than to those occurring in dreams... Man... is above all the plaything of his memory.
author: Andre Breton

text: Dreams pass into the reality of action. From the actions stems the dream again and this interdependence produces the highest form of living.
author: Anais Nin

text: It never occurred to me that I'd be on a television show or in feature films but when those came into play my dreams changed along the way.
author: Camryn Manheim

text: Looking back 25 years later, what I may say is that the facts have been far better than the dreams. In the long course of cell life on this earth it remained, for our age for our generation, to receive the full ownership of our inheritance.
author: Albert Claude

text: I began my career with infantile dreams of becoming a composer.
author: Ivor Novello

text: When the legends die, the dreams end there is no more greatness.
author: Tecumseh

text: I've always said that one night, I'm going to find myself in some field somewhere, I'm standing on grass, and it's raining, and I'm with the person I love, and I know I'm at the very point I've been dreaming of getting to.
author: Drew Barrymore

text: So many financial dreams are thwarted by the failure to act upon good intentions.
author: Suze Orman

text: When I first left Iran at the age of 13, Iran had become such a shining star - it was the point to which all my desires and dreams returned.
author: Azar Nafisi

text: My hero's, my dreams, and my future lie in Yankee Stadium and they can't take that from me.
author: Derek Jeter

text: I want my boys to have an understanding of people's emotions, their insecurities, people's distress, and their hopes and dreams.
author: Princess Diana

text: When you stop having dreams and ideals - well, you might as well stop altogether.
author: Marian Anderson

text: It's not my job to dream your dreams. It's my job to make your dreams become a reality.
author: Blanche Lincoln

text: We live because of the dreams.
author: Marat Safin

text: I want to help children in Serbia and around the world so they can realize their dreams.
author: Novak Djokovic

text: The human heart has hidden treasures, In secret kept, in silence sealed The thoughts, the hopes, the dreams, the pleasures, Whose charms were broken if revealed.
author: Charlotte Bronte

text: Field of Dreams is probably our generation's It's A Wonderful Life.
author: Kevin Costner

text: IN April 1882 my father died and I was at once whirled out of my land of dreams into a very different sphere.
author: Edward Carpenter

text: If you take responsibility for yourself you will develop a hunger to accomplish your dreams.
author: Les Brown

text: Stay focused, go after your dreams and keep moving toward your goals.
author: LL Cool J

text: Men act out like they're horrified by marriage, but when they find the woman of their dreams, they love it.
author: Rachel Hunter

text: As I've grown - dare I say it - older, I had hopes of indulging my dreams of being a sailor.
author: Jimmy Webb

text: It's not too late, I can still live my dreams.
author: Diana Nyad

text: Women are not in love with me but with the picture of me on the screen. I am merely the canvas on which women paint their dreams.
author: Rudolph Valentino

text: In my wildest dreams, I could not have imagined a sweeter life.
author: Hugh Hefner

text: In a couple, sometimes, one or both people have to give up their personal life, dreams and ambitions for the good of the family.
author: Monica Bellucci

text: It is great good health to believe, as the Hindus do, that there are 33 million gods and goddesses in the world. It is great good health to want to understand one's dreams. It is great good health to desire the ambiguous and paradoxical.
author: Clive Barker

text: People are learning to feel more comfortable hearing one another's dreams. It used to be that if you told a dream in public, someone had to make a joke to relieve the tension introduced by that alternative reality.
author: Henry Reed

text: I am not ridiculing verbal mechanisms, dreams, or repressions as origins of poetry all three of them and more besides may have a great deal to do with it.
author: Allen Tate

text: As you look back at your life, there are just a million different things that have happened, just in the right way, to allow you to make your dreams come true. And you know, someone has all that under control.
author: Michael P. Anderson

text: The only book by a modern president that bears serious comparison with Obama's 'Dreams From My Father' is Jimmy Carter's short campaign autobiography, 'Why Not the Best?,' published in 1975.
author: Jonathan Raban

text: I had dreams of catching the ball for the final out in the World Series and being mobbed by my teammates. Well, I guess all my dreams didn't come true.
author: Robin Yount

text: I love working with kids, talking with them and listening to them. I always encourage kids to reach beyond their dreams. Don't try to be like me. Be better than me.
author: Florence Griffith Joyner

text: What is life? A madness. What is life? An illusion, a shadow, a story. And the greatest good is little enough for all life is a dream, and dreams themselves are only dreams.
author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

text: There are no dreams too large, no innovation unimaginable and no frontiers beyond our reach.
author: John S. Herrington

text: Without leaps of imagination, or dreaming, we lose the excitement of possibilities. Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning.
author: Gloria Steinem

text: Dreams can still come true you need a great deal of energy and determination, and a little bit of luck.
author: Stefano Gabbana

text: Having achieved my own dreams, I want to give to kids who are less fortunate, who struggle with everyday obstacles. I want to give them something positive in their lives: support.
author: Kristi Yamaguchi

text: All the characters in my books are imagined, but all have a bit of who I am in them - much like the characters in your dreams are all formed by who you are.
author: Alice Hoffman

text: Obviously one must hold oneself responsible for the evil impulses of one's dreams. In what other way can one deal with them? Unless the content of the dream rightly understood is inspired by alien spirits, it is part of my own being.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: Do It Under the Influence Yourself! That's what we're shooting for! Get drunk and make your dreams come true.
author: Aziz Ansari

text: You control your future, your destiny. What you think about comes about. By recording your dreams and goals on paper, you set in motion the process of becoming the person you most want to be. Put your future in good hands - your own.
author: Mark Victor Hansen

text: In our dreams we are always young.
author: Sarah Louise Delany

text: Both dreams and myths are important communications from ourselves to ourselves. If we do not understand the language in which they are written, we miss a great deal of what we know and tell ourselves in those hours when we are not busy manipulating the outside world.
author: Erich Fromm

text: I can never decide whether my dreams are the result of my thoughts, or my thoughts the result of my dreams.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

text: The interpretation of dreams is the royal road to a knowledge of the unconscious activities of the mind.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: Here's what I see all across this great city - people working together to make Boston a better place to live and to raise children, to grow and pursue dreams.
author: Thomas Menino

text: Our dreams are a second life. I have never been able to penetrate without a shudder those ivory or horned gates which separate us from the invisible world.
author: Gerard De Nerval

text: Dreams have as much influence as actions.
author: Stephane Mallarme

text: That's what keeps me going: dreaming, inventing, then hoping and dreaming some more in order to keep dreaming.
author: Joseph Barbera

text: Happiness is making your dreams come true.
author: Jourdan Dunn

text: Seems like God don't see fit to give the black man nothing but dreams - but He did give us children to make them dreams seem worthwhile.
author: Lorraine Hansberry

text: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: So, I think that Marilyn, what she gave the world, and in many ways Kennedy too, was that they had dreams and they didn't allow anybody to take away their dreams.
author: Sally Kirkland

text: I have actual dreams of Bruce Springsteen calling me up on stage to wear a bandanna and play rhythm guitar next to Little Steven.
author: Tom Perrotta

text: I think dreams can come true, but not necessarily like fairy-tales. It's not always so perfect like that.
author: Patrick Dempsey

text: Only things the dreamers make live on. They are the eternal conquerors.
author: Herbert Kaufman

text: Dream as if you'll live forever. Live as if you'll die today.
author: James Dean

text: Have you ever wondered why young people take to music like fish to water? Maybe it's because music is fun. Plan and simple. It opens up their minds to dream great dreams about where they can go and what they can do when they get older.
author: Isaac Hayes

text: We grew up founding our dreams on the infinite promise of American advertising. I still believe that one can learn to play the piano by mail and that mud will give you a perfect complexion.
author: Zelda Fitzgerald

text: I prefer to be a dreamer among the humblest, with visions to be realized, than lord among those without dreams and desires.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: But what I'd really like to tell you is I never dreamed of being in the Hall of Fame. Standing here with all these great players was beyond any of my dreams.
author: Robin Yount

text: Dreaming or awake, we perceive only events that have meaning to us.
author: Jane Roberts

text: I did commit to myself that I would not jump back into being the workaholic that I can be before I gave myself an honest opportunity to create the marriage of my dreams and to create the beginning of the family of my dreams, and that took a hot second.
author: Alanis Morissette

text: Keep true to the dreams of your youth.
author: Friedrich Schiller

text: Talking about food is like talking about your dreams. Everyone has something to say. We all have to eat, it's just what we eat which differs. Some people eat for fuel and I feel bad for them.
author: Gael Garcia Bernal

text: When violence becomes imbedded in a region, then this affects everything. It affects your dreams, your fantasies and relationships, and your religion becomes violent, too.
author: Karen Armstrong

text: Intellectual despair results in neither weakness nor dreams, but in violence. It is only a matter of knowing how to give vent to one's rage whether one only wants to wander like madmen around prisons, or whether one wants to overturn them.
author: Georges Bataille

text: Today I know that there is still work to be done, but along the way my I am achieving my dreams.
author: Candace Parker

text: Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Dreams really tell you about yourself more than anything else in this world could ever tell you.
author: Sylvia Browne

text: I'm not just a boy toy. I have feelings and dreams like anybody else.
author: Jon Stewart

text: I really had a lot of dreams when I was a kid, and I think a great deal of that grew out of the fact that I had a chance to read a lot.
author: Bill Gates

text: A runner must run with dreams in his heart, not money in his pocket.
author: Emil Zatopek

text: Google is a global Rorschach test. We see in it what we want to see. Google has built an infrastructure that makes a lot of dreams closer to reality.
author: John Battelle

text: Those born into poverty or on the margins of society require our extra support to realize their dreams.
author: Novak Djokovic

text: I'm particularly proud of my reluctance to share my dreams with anyone.
author: Todd Barry

text: Not all lucid dreams are useful but they all have a sense of wonder about them. If you must sleep through a third of your life, why should you sleep through your dreams, too?
author: Stephen LaBerge

text: I think people tend to see the bigger point, which is maybe not fitting in and feeling like you didn't have the childhood that you expected you would have, or that you felt lonely or struggled with drugs and alcohol or just that you were able to achieve your dreams.
author: Augusten Burroughs

text: Reality is wrong. Dreams are for real.
author: Tupac Shakur

text: The work goes on, the cause endures, the hope still lives and the dreams shall never die.
author: Edward Kennedy

text: Field of Dreams is the only movie - and I saw it in the theater - on an afternoon when I was on location somewhere, and there were like 12 people in the theater. I was just so devastated I couldn't get out of my seat. And I sat and watched it a second time.
author: Paul Reiser

text: Our fathers had their dreams we have ours the generation that follows will have its own. Without dreams and phantoms man cannot exist.
author: Olive Schreiner

text: Of all our dreams today there is none more important - or so hard to realise - than that of peace in the world. May we never lose our faith in it or our resolve to do everything that can be done to convert it one day into reality.
author: Lester B. Pearson

text: Our dreams drench us in senses, and senses steps us again in dreams.
author: Amos Bronson Alcott

text: I led the life of an intellectual up until a certain age. I remember Freud's 'Interpretation of Dreams' was a big favorite when I was 11. It sounded so interesting. And it really was!
author: Wallace Shawn

text: Dreams from 1991 are becoming reality. We will build good relations between nations and people. We will strive towards mutual respect and equality of every individual, sex, race and national or any other minority.
author: Janez Drnovsek

text: Thanking you once more, I want to wish you the best of luck for your future life and to conclude by saying to you: Dream your dreams and may they come true!
author: Felix Bloch

text: We all dream we do not understand our dreams, yet we act as if nothing strange goes on in our sleep minds, strange at least by comparison with the logical, purposeful doings of our minds when we are awake.
author: Erich Fromm

text: I think cinema is closer to allegories than to reality. It's closer to our dreams.
author: Manuel Puig

text: Was it only by dreaming or writing that I could find out what I thought?
author: Joan Didion

text: I have had dreams and I have had nightmares, but I have conquered my nightmares because of my dreams.
author: Jonas Salk

text: But I am delighted to be a Dodger, I grew up a Dodger fan and now my dreams have really come true.
author: Milton Bradley

text: Dreams sometimes foretell the future.
author: Mickey Hart

text: One of my dreams in life is to do fund-raising for the youth.
author: Picabo Street

text: Dreams are where we visit the many lands and landscapes of human possibility and discover the one where we feel at home. The great religious leaders were all dreamers.
author: Jonathan Sacks

text: What differentiates us from animals is the fact that we can listen to other people's dreams, fears, joys, sorrows, desires and defeats - and they in turn can listen to ours.
author: Henning Mankell

text: If you choose not to pursue your dreams, you'll still be a part of a dream - only it will be someone else's.
author: Mike Hawkins

text: That disturbs people when they know they didn't have the guts or integrity to stick to their dreams.
author: Sandra Bernhard

text: My dreams are all follies.
author: Taylor Caldwell

text: Las Vegas is a very strange place. It's a place of broken dreams.
author: Concha Buika

text: It is easier to learn to interpret dreams if you have a reason to use them for something constructive. You apply your dream insights to making constructive changes in your life.
author: Henry Reed

text: But I, being poor, have only my dreams I have spread my dreams under your feet Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.
author: William Butler Yeats

text: I don't use drugs, my dreams are frightening enough.
author: M. C. Escher

text: I'm aware of the mystery around us, so I write about coincidences, premonitions, emotions, dreams, the power of nature, magic.
author: Isabel Allende

text: A test of what is real is that it is hard and rough. Joys are found in it, not pleasure. What is pleasant belongs to dreams.
author: Simone Weil

text: Mr. Tennyson has said that more things are wrought by prayer than this world dreams of, but he wisely refrains from saying whether they are good or bad things.
author: Samuel Butler

text: I adore this adventure, I adore working with youth. For me it's a daily challenge, working to help these youths realize their dreams.
author: Patrick Roy

text: It's weird to say, but every time I look at my daughter and I see this little living breathing thing that came from me, that represents all of the hopes and dreams that I would want for her, I see a miracle.
author: Josh Gad

text: Things have gone beyond my wildest expectations and dreams, and I feel like I've been given so many blessings in my life, between my friendship with the guys in the band, our wonderful audience, being able to play this music, and then my family.
author: Trey Anastasio

text: The human imagination... has great difficulty in living strictly within the confines of a materialist practice or philosophy. It dreams, like a dog in its basket, of hares in the open.
author: John Berger

text: The dreamer can know no truth, not even about his dream, except by awaking out of it.
author: George Santayana

text: Acting is also working with people who invite you into their dreams and trust you with their innermost being.
author: Catherine Deneuve

text: Vain hopes are like certain dreams of those who wake.
author: Quintilian

text: Ground not upon dreams you know they are ever contrary.
author: Thomas Middleton

text: People ask how can a Jewish kid from the Bronx do preppy clothes? Does it have to do with class and money? It has to do with dreams.
author: Ralph Lauren

text: Dreams are real as long as they last. Can we say more of life?
author: Havelock Ellis

text: I just kind of wake up with a new idea and new dreams every day, and I follow that dream, as they say.
author: Dolly Parton

text: An athlete cannot run with money in his pockets. He must run with hope in his heart and dreams in his head.
author: Emil Zatopek

text: To be given the opportunity to help shape new artists' careers and mentor them to see their dreams come to fruition is a task I welcome with open arms.
author: Christina Aguilera

text: Through hard work, perseverance and a faith in God, you can live your dreams.
author: Benjamin Carson

text: In my wildest dreams I never thought - well, I never thought I'd work.
author: Steve Carell

text: I mean, every child at one stage dreams of being a prince or a princess.
author: Mary, Crown Princess of Denmark

text: For all life is a dream, and dreams themselves are only dreams.
author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

text: It's not only imagination, it's the distortion of the vision. You suddenly think, This person is idealistic, this person is strong, this person has dreams, when you know better most of the time. You put what you want to see on people.
author: Olivier Martinez

text: Every actor dreams of getting a big break, a big opportunity.
author: Liam McIntyre

text: This may sound strange but I had dreams as a kid of doing exactly what I ended up doing in my life.
author: Corey Hart

text: I worked on my voice for Sweet Dreams, but only to match my speaking voice to Patsy's actual singing voice. That was my way into that character.
author: Jessica Lange

text: My own dreams fortunately came true in this great state. I became Mr. Universe I became a successful businessman. And even though some people say I still speak with a slight accent, I have reached the top of the acting profession.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

text: Dreams can become a reality when we possess a vision that is characterized by the willingness to work hard, a desire for excellence, and a belief in our right and our responsiblity to be equal members of society.
author: Janet Jackson

text: Believe in and follow your dreams.
author: Kristanna Loken

text: Tell me about yourself - your struggles, your dreams, your telephone number.
author: Peter Arno

text: Dream and give yourself permission to envision a You that you choose to be.
author: Joy Page

text: A man is a god in ruins. When men are innocent, life shall be longer, and shall pass into the immortal, as gently as we awake from dreams.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The interpretation of dreams is a great art.
author: Paracelsus

text: We didn't know how to run a business, but we had dreams and talent.
author: Ruth Handler

text: Let us keep the dance of rain our fathers kept and tread our dreams beneath the jungle sky.
author: Arna Bontemps

text: We all have our time machines. Some take us back, they're called memories. Some take us forward, they're called dreams.
author: Jeremy Irons

text: I'm sure I have a process, but it mostly takes place in my dreams.
author: William H. Macy

text: I've got heaps of dreams.
author: Abbie Cornish

text: I'll let you be in my dreams if I can be in yours.
author: Bob Dylan

text: Dreams will get you nowhere, a good kick in the pants will take you a long way.
author: Baltasar Gracian
